newsitem.title: VENEZUELA: Caracas shares end lower in profit taking.
newsitem.headline: Caracas shares end lower in profit taking.

text.p: Shares on the Caracas Stock Exchange fell across-the-board in sluggish trading as profit- taking reversed three consecutive days of rising prices, brokers said.
According to preliminary figures from the exchange, the market's 19-share index fell 1.35 percent to 6,165.32 as 12 stocks rose, 22 slipped and 11 closed flat.
"Sellers came out to take prices down and we saw all the market leaders fall," one broker said.
Trading volumes were weak, brokers said, with 2.038 billion bolivars ($4.3 million) changing hands.

The only bright spot in a dull day's trading, brokers said, was the debut of investment company Vencred which opened at 2,500.00 bolivars and hit 5,000.00 bolivars before closing at 4,250.00 bolivars.

Among leading stocks, telephone company CANTV edged up 5.00 bolivars to 1780.00 bolivars, electric utility Electricidad de Caracas fell 11.00 bolivars to 523.00 bolivars and steel company Sivensa fell 6.90 bolivars to 321.10 bolivars.
